features: 【Seamless Performance and Ample Storage Space】Experience the exceptional unlocked Android phone equipped with 4GB of RAM and 64GB of ROM. Powered by an MTK6739 CPU and running on Android 10.0, the V50 unlocked cell phone effortlessly switches between tasks, smoothly plays multimedia content, and handles multitasking with ease, delivering a seamless operational experience. With expandable storage of up to 256GB, you can download music, movies, and apps according to your preferences.

【Vibrant Display and Stylish Design】Immerse yourself in captivating visual effects on the 6.5 inch large screen with a resolution of 720x1600. Whether you're reading articles or watching videos, the display is clear and vivid. Paired with a 15MP rear camera, the mobile phone easily captures the beauty of details. The vertically arranged three rear cameras exude minimalism and style, complemented by the unique matte back cover, which lends the unlocked phone a premium and elegant texture.

【Long-lasting Battery Life for All-day Enjoyment】With a 4500mAh battery, enjoy extended battery life that lasts the entire day, eliminating the need for frequent charging. The unlocked smartphone's moderate weight, comfortable grip, and stylish matte back cover seamlessly integrate into your life. Unlike heavier Android phones with larger batteries, the Xgody V50 unlocked cell phone strikes a balance between comfort and functionality.

【Secure Unlocking and Dual SIM Convenience】Unlock effortlessly with facial recognition, ensuring the security of your information. Dual SIM slots support dual 4G LTE, allowing you to maintain seamless 4G LTE network connectivity for the other SIM card even while on a call. The Xgody V50 smartphones unlocked excel in every aspect, from entertainment to photography, from work to socializing. With its sleek design and powerful features, this phone is your ideal companion.

【Compatible with T-Mobile and AT&T】The Xgody V50 andriod cell phone is a 4G LTE Unlocked phone that works with AT&T and T-Mobile networks and their MVNO networks. Please note that a SIM card is not included. For more information on compatibility with your carrier's program, please check directly with them. (Not compatible with Cricket, Verizon or with CDMA Networks like Sprint and Boost Mobile).

【Professional After-sales Team】 Should you encounter any issues while using our products, please do not hesitate to contact us. Contact entry: Find the corresponding order, then find "Contact Seller", click to enter and select the relevant topic to contact. Our team will promptly review your concerns within 12 hours and respond within 24 hours with a solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Considering the low cost, those phone seems really good value! I am actually quite impressed. The camera in particular is quite decent - it won't great Google, iPhone or Sony of course but for the price it is better than I expected - crisp, clear photos with decent stabilization on both front and rear cam. It does not have the same level of processing that branded phones do though of course, so the digital zoom is pretty terrible and photos in low light conditions are grainy, dark and blurry.Connectivity is not bad, I've had a stable phone connection so far with no issues in call dropping or interference. It only has 4G connectivity though, no 5G.Overall, if you're between phones right now or are looking for a cheaper alternative phone to take with you to festivals and concerts save risking your brand new flagship phone, this one would be a great option as the camera is pretty decent, the battery life is good and you can't beat the value

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For much of the UK 5g is not an option, so why not just use a great value 4g phone? This is great as a backup phone. I often go out walking in horrible conditions and wouldn't want to lose or damage my up to date branded phone. Using this as a backup is reassuring. It isn't the fastest phone, but for maps, social networking, and taking pictures it is fine. Good battery life, not overly large or heavy, this phone is great to take outside, or for a messy night out. The screen is bright, crisp, and very clear. The camera is great for everyday photos. For under 70 this sim free unlocked phone is a no brainer choice. Impressed and very pleased with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Everything you need to know before buying the Xgody V50!
reviews.reviewText: The Xgody V50 piqued my interest primarily because of its enticingly competitive price, especially when compared to other flagship models. Given its price bracket, my expectations were modest. Upon receiving the phone, the design and build were eerily reminiscent of my Samsung Galaxy S21. It's undeniable that Xgody has taken design cues from premium phones, a move that elevates the V50’s aesthetic appeal, making it look more upscale than its price suggests.Delving deeper into its features, I was generally pleased. The camera functionality, particularly the clarity of the pictures and videos, was a standout. The photos captured were crisp, and videos maintained a decent level of stability. Call quality was consistent with clear audibility, and messaging was seamless. The internet connectivity was swift, enabling smooth browsing and streaming, a feature often compromised in budget smartphones.However, the V50 wasn’t without its minor hitches. While the design mimicked premium phones, the feel in hand did betray its budget nature. The body, though sleek, felt a tad plasticky, lacking the heft and premium touch of its more expensive counterparts. Moreover, while the Android 10 system offered a stable experience, occasional lags were noticeable, especially when multitasking or running heavy apps.The battery performance, on the other hand, was commendable. Even with rigorous usage, it consistently lasted more than a day, putting some flagship models to shame. The charging, though not the fastest, was adequately quick, ensuring you're not tethered to the charger for too long.In conclusion, the Xgody V50 is a mixed bag of impressive features and some shortcomings. For its price, it's undeniably a steal, offering functionalities that are usually reserved for higher-priced phones. It's an ideal choice for those who want a decent smartphone experience without breaking the bank. While it might not replace a flagship for those accustomed to premium experiences, it's a worthy contender in the budget segment.Thank you for reading my honest review, I hope you found it helpful! :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: A good basic (or backup) phone, let down by poor camera.
reviews.reviewText: At first glance, this is a nice-looking Android phone with a stylish finish and reasonable screen. For the money - I think it was £69 when I received it - it certainly represents good value, but don't expect anything more than adequate performance.The screen quality and brightness are reasonable (7/10), and it's certainly good enough to watch YouTube, play undemanding games on, browse the internet/read emails, etc.The phone is sluggish when you try to carry out certain tasks - trying to take a photo is nothing short of painful, and the quality of the photos - even in good light - is poor compared to high-end phones, but at as much as 1/20th of the price, you should expect that - see example photo, attached.More demanding games are unplayable on this, but slower games are okay - Candy Crush performs pretty well, for example.The battery life is good - it will last about 3 or 4 days on standby.The phone appears to be stuck on Android 10, which is 4 years old and is now considered "end of life", with the final update being released in February 2023, so I wouldn't recommend using this as your primary phone with all your personal details on it, but it's probably okay as a backup phone in emergencies or as a phone for a younger child who won't have any personal data stored on it.Speaking of security, since setting up this phone, I've had a few text message one-time password verifications relating to resetting Telegram, Microsoft, Freelancer, Amazon and Paypal accounts (one in Italian) - and I don't even have accounts for all of these services, but I'm not sure if that relates to the phone number I'm using - a separate number on a basic package or the accounts I've connected to the phone - again, not my main email account, to be safe, so I will reserve judgement for the time being. I've installed MalwareBytes Pro and done a full scan, which has brought up nothing. Though I confess, I did wonder if this related to the phone itself, but I can't see anything to indicate that's the cause of this issue.Overall, it's a basic phone, fine for a non-power user, as it will carry out non-demanding tasks adequately, but it wouldn't be my first choice of phone unless I was on a restricted budget.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Great as a first smartphone for kids or elder people
reviews.reviewText: In all fairness, it is an amazing phone for the price. So you get a phone, charging cable and a plug, screen protector, and a clear silicone case for £70. Huge screen, Android 10 OS, 13MP camera, 2 sim cards, 4GB internal memory and you can still expand it.Yes, of course, it is not as fast as the latest smartphones in £300+ range but common - that's a very unfair comparison.I am actually quite impressed and also angry at the same time since I started realizing how much we pay for the brand name only.Anyway, I won't be using it myself but as said before - great first smartphone and not huge loss if say broken, lost or stolen.
